definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Country-music fans everywhere, know his big hits.
sentences.chinese: 全国各地音乐爱好者，知道他的点击率较高。

sentences.english: How have you been using social bookmarking to drive traffic to your blog?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎样利用社会书签为你博客带来高点击率的呢？

sentences.english: It could view “click-through rates” as a measure of ad quality.
sentences.chinese: 通过察看“点击率”可以作为判断广告质量的标准。

sentences.english: Even if the blog click-through rate, although the Han Han a little more, but the GJM is not bad.
sentences.chinese: 即使博客点击率，虽然韩寒多一点，但郭敬明也不差。

sentences.english: The blogs are ranked by the number of clicks they receive.
sentences.chinese: 我们正对这些博客的点击率进行大排行。

sentences.english: It has decent CTRs for search and display, but needs attention.
sentences.chinese: 它的搜索和显示体面的点击率，但需要注意。

sentences.english: Which users are getting the most click-throughs?
sentences.chinese: 哪个用户获得的点击率最高？

sentences.english: It’s more important for people to read your content and stay up to date with your content than for people to click through.
sentences.chinese: 提升网站内容的可读性和黏度远比点击率重要。

sentences.english: He pens a column in Yingyuzatan. It becomes one of the most widely read here.
sentences.chinese: 他在英语杂谈写一个专栏，是点击率最高的文章之一。

sentences.english: You also need lots of page views and a high click-through rate.
sentences.chinese: 您还需要大量的页面浏览量和高点击率。

sentences.english: Many advertise rate the success of a given ad placement on clickthrough rate alone.
sentences.chinese: 许多广告速度给定的成功广告放置在单独的点击率。

definition: number of clicks/number of hits (on a website)
to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
public praise/public reputation/commonly held opinions/current idiom
to increase followers/to get more fans
cotyledon of a bean (i.e. either of the halves of a bean seed that can be split apart after removing the seed coat)/thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4 ban4 jiang4])
